Millions of working people want to start a family and would like to care for their children at home, but current policies do not respect these preferences.

Hawley: "American families should be supported, no matter how they choose to care for their kids." https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/news/hawley-12k-tax-credit-married-parents

How do parents get it?

The tax credit is delivered to eligible parents through automatic, monthly advances -- right into the same bank accounts where parents receive their federal tax refunds.

It's also a proposal that rewards work.

To receive the Parent Tax Credit, households would report their prior-year earnings, greater than or equal to income from an average of 20 hours per week of work at the federal minimum wage.

Hawley's proposal would be one of the LARGEST tax cuts for working families in American history.

It's a fully refundable tax credit available to households with children under the age of 13 - totaling $6,000 for single parents and $12,000 for couples (annually).

Hawley On His Parent Tax Credit Proposal:

"Our tax laws explicitly promote both commercial daycare and two-income households. But those are choices that should belong to families, not Washington."

*Parents,* not DC, should decide how to raise their kids. https://www.foxbusiness.com/politics/parenthood-marriage-work-parent-tax-credit-josh-hawley

RT @WashTimes Opinion | Democrats' move on lending rule shows they simply won't let working class have access to credit

https://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2021/may/10/democrats-move-on-lending-rule-shows-they-simply-w/

Ensuring Americans have access to the credit they need is fundamental to their success.

Upholding the True Lender rule is critical to achieving this goal.

MYTH: Repealing True Lender protects consumers.

FACT: Repealing True Lender would harm consumers by making access to credit costlier and more difficult‚Äîpushing many lower-income and higher-risk families out of the legal, regulated credit market entirely.

MYTH: True Lender is a Trump-era rule only supported by Republicans.

FACT: Non-political career staff at the OCC asked Congress not to repeal True Lender.

MYTH: True Lender facilitates ‚Äúrent-a-charter‚Äù arrangements.

FACT: True Lender actually prevents ‚Äúrent-a-charters‚Äù by ensuring the bank is on the hook for the loan.

MYTH: The True Lender rule encourages predatory lending.

FACT: True Lender actually protects against predatory lending by ensuring OCC has regulatory and supervisory oversight of bank-fintech issued loans.

In the wake of this new rule, anti-credit groups and Democrats in Washington have been spreading falsehoods about the True Lender rule.

Here are the FACTS.

These bank-fintech partnerships are making it easier than ever to access credit, but there's been some confusion over who is the "true lender."

Is the bank or the fintech company ultimately responsible for the loan?

The True Lender rule answers that question: It's the bank.

Technology is making everyone‚Äôs life easier, and banking is no exception.

Thanks to banks partnering with financial technology companies‚Äîknown as fintechs‚Äîwe can now use our smartphones to take out a loan to buy a new car or fix up our home.

There's a lot of misinformation circulating about the OCC‚Äôs True Lender rule and what it means for consumers.

Let's break it down.
